output: Treatment types: 1) Internal medicines - Choornam (powder), Lehyam (paste), Kasayam (decoction), Thailam (oil), Maathirai (pills), 2) External - Pattru (poultice), Ottradam (fomentation), Nasiyam (nasal), Kattu (bandage), 3) Surgical - Siddha surgery, 4) Special therapies - Thokkanam (massage), Varmam, Yoga. Panchagavya: Cow products based. Kayakalpa: Rejuvenation therapy.

NO! Most antibiotics = Schedule H - prescription mandatory. Reason: Antibiotic resistance is serious health threat. Pharmacy violation: Drug Inspector complaint, license action. Exception: Some topical antibiotics (creams) may be OTC. Good practice: Complete prescribed course, don't share antibiotics, don't use leftover. Doctor: Can prescribe over phone in genuine emergency.
